greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binomial(2n, n) - 2 mod n^3.
comment: When e=3, the numbers binomial(2n, n) - 2 mod n^e are 0 whenever n is a prime greater than 3 (Wolstenholme's theorem; see A246130 for introductory comments). No composite number n for which a(n)=0 was found up to n=431500 (conjecture: there are none, and a(n)=0 for n>3 is a deterministic primality test).
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: seq(binomial(2*n,n)-2 mod n^3, n=1..100); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 17 2014
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Aug 16 2014
